version_description:
- Main screen lists the organizations that the user is registered with, replacing list of service.
- The services list of each company is now shown under the company name: SSO, VPN and SSH. More can be added in the future.
- Users can "Remove Company" by clicking the company name.
- New option to disable swipe through settings and authenticate with OTP only, following customers requests. Useful for scenarios where you know data network won't be available.
- Bug fixes, performance and speed optimization

- Main screen lists the organizations that the user is registered with, replacing list of service.
- The services list of each company is now shown under the company name: SSO, VPN and SSH. More can be added in the future.
- Users can "Remove Company" by clicking the company name.
- New option to disable swipe through settings and authenticate with OTP only, following customers requests. Useful for scenarios where you know data network won't be available.
- Bug fixes, performance and speed optimization
- Bug Fixes.
- Bug Fixes.

- Improved authentication responsiveness on Apple Watch.

- Bug fixes.

- New languages supported (Dutch, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Thai, Chinese).
- Every update includes improvements to performance and reliability.

- When a user gets a new device restored from his old device, they can now use the PingID app on their old device to change devices and pair the new one.
- Every update includes improvements to performance and reliability.

Version 1.8.2:
- Bugfix: Error during copy/paste of pairing key on mobile devices.

Version 1.8.1:
- Enhanced privacy for supporting General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements.
- Every update includes improvements to performance and reliability.

- Support for manual authentication flow. Used during service interruptions, or network connectivity issues.
- Improved authentication speed on Apple Watch.
- From this version the App supports only iOS 8.0 and above.

- The Face ID background icon is now presented on all supported devices.
- Depending on organization policy, some devices that support Face ID might be required to approve face scans upon authentication for consent and improved security.
- User experience has improved for users enrolling through email links, with a redirection to the PingID app instead of Safari.
- It's recommended to upgrade to the latest iOS version to avoid a known issue in iOS 13.0 through 13.1.1 that prevents the biometric dialog from displaying in the authentication screen.
- Every update includes improvements to performance and reliability.

- The Face ID background icon is now presented on all supported devices.
- Depending on organization policy, some devices that support Face ID might be required to approve face scans upon authentication for consent and improved security.
- User experience has improved for users enrolling through email links, with a redirection to the PingID app instead of Safari.
- It's recommended to upgrade to the latest iOS version to avoid a known issue in iOS 13.0 through 13.1.1 that prevents the biometric dialog from displaying in the authentication screen.
- Every update includes improvements to performance and reliability.

- This version of PingID mobile app does not support iOS 10.x and lower.
- Fixed an issue that was preventing some users from authenticating correctly with push notifications.
